qas.question: Many different types of interaction can be controlled by how many buttons?
Where can players see what action will be performed in different scenarios?
If Link is not moving, where will he put the projectile he's carrying?
What mechanic allows one button to serve many functions?
What shows what action the button will trigger?
Many different types of interaction can be controlled by how many rocks?
Where can players see what action will be performed in different rocks?
If Link is not moving, where will he put the enemy he's carrying?
What mechanic allows two buttons to serve many functions?
What shows what action the rock will trigger?

context: The <a3_0><b8_0>context-sensitive button mechanic<b8_0/><a3_0/> allows <a0_0><b5_0>one<b5_0/><a0_0/> button to serve a variety of functions, such as talking, opening doors, and pushing, pulling, and throwing objects.[e] The <a1_0><a4_0><b6_0><b9_0>on-screen display<b9_0/><b6_0/><a4_0/><a1_0/> shows what action, if any, the button will trigger, determined by the situation. For example, if Link is holding a rock, the context-sensitive button will cause Link to throw the rock if he is moving or targeting an object or enemy, or place the rock <a2_0><b7_0>on the ground<b7_0/><a2_0/> if he is standing still.[f]
